com.habelitz.jsobjectizer.jsom.api.statement
Interface ForStatement

All Superinterfaces:
JSOM, Statement, StatementBlockElement
public interface ForStatement
extends Statement

This Statement type represents a for statement.

Note that this interface represents classic for statements only. The forEach variant is represented by it's own interface ForEachStatement.

The JSOM abstraction of for statements looks like 

     for(initializer; condition; updater) statement
and matches the following rules:
  • there're two variants for the initializer
    • zero or one local variable declaration
    • zero or more expressions
  • the condition can be stated by zero or one expression and
  • the updater can be stated by zero or more expressions.
The method getForInitType() can be used to find out of what variant the initializer is.

Author:
Dieter Habelitz
See Also:
ForEachStatement

Method Detail

getForCondition

Expression getForCondition()
Returns the for statement's condition expression.

Returns:
The for statement's condition expression or null if no condition expression has been stated.

getForInitType

ForStatement.ForInitType getForInitType()
Returns the type of the for statement's initializer variant.

Returns:
One of the ForStatement.ForInitType constants.

getForUpdaters

java.util.List<Expression> getForUpdaters()
Returns a list of the for statement's updater expressions.

Calling this method equals an getForUpdaters(null) call.

Returns:
A list of the for statement's updater expressions. If no updaters have been stated null will be returned.
See Also:
getForUpdaters(List)

getForUpdaters

java.util.List<Expression> getForUpdaters(java.util.List<Expression> pList)
Returns a list of the for statement's updater expressions.

Parameters:
pList - If this argument isn't null the expressions will be added to this list and this list object will be returned. Otherwise a new list will be created for the result.
Returns:
A list of the for statement's updater expressions. If no updaters have been stated null will be returned, even if the argument pList isn't null.

getInitializerExpressions

java.util.List<Expression> getInitializerExpressions()
Returns a list of the expressions stated within the for statement's initializer.

Calling this method equals an getInitializerExpressions(null) call.

Returns:
A list of the for statement's initializer expressions. If 'getForInitType() != ForInitType.EXPRESSION null will be returned.
See Also:
getInitializerExpressions(List)

getInitializerExpressions

java.util.List<Expression> getInitializerExpressions(java.util.List<Expression> pList)
Returns a list of the expressions stated within the for statement's initializer.

Parameters:
pList - If this argument isn't null the expressions will be added to this list and this list object will be returned. Otherwise a new list will be created for the result.
Returns:
A list of the for statement's initializer expressions. If 'getForInitType() != ForInitType.EXPRESSION null will be returned, even if the argument pList isn't null.

getInitializerVarDecl

LocalVariableDeclaration getInitializerVarDecl()
Returns the local variable declaration stated within the for statement's initializer.

Returns:
The for statement's initializer variable declaration or null if getForInitType() != ForInitType.VAR_DECL.

getStatement

Statement getStatement()
Returns the statement that should be executed by the for loop.

Returns:
The statement that should be executed by the for loop.

hasForCondition

boolean hasForCondition()
Tells if the for statement has a condition expression.

Returns:
true if the for statement has a condition expression.

hasForUpdater

boolean hasForUpdater()
Tells if the for statement has at least one updater expression.

Returns:
true if the for statement has at least one updater expression.
